Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with traces of two added white bands; exterior, slip worn, reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Well 101 (= Well 5)
Curator's comments: The number 101 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it difficult to ascertain what group this sherd belongs to. Chalice Style chalices are smaller than those in earlier styles and they are not elaborately decorated on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0915) (phase 2)
